result.execSummary:
All charges against Scott Michael Hotchkiss in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott Michael Hotchkiss is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Michael Hotchkiss

defendant.name: Hotchkiss, Scott Michael
defendant.address: 150 South Street W, South St. Paul, MN 55075

records.addlTxt: 2:33 PM Scott Michael Hotchkiss appears from Jail in person, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Joseph M. Schieffer for the State of Wisconsin. Victim appears by phone. The State is ready to proceed. Inv. Eric Vannocker. S/T. ADA Schieffer questions Inv. Vannocker. Record reflects identification of DE. Cross Atty Nelson. Redirect ADA Schieffer, redirect Atty Nelson. ADA Schieffer is requesting the Court find probable cause and bind DE over, Atty Nelson argues. Court finds the State has not met its burden and the case is dismissed without prejudice. Court adjourned at 2:55 pm.
Document 10 was erased. Unsigned bond is not needed in court record.
filed by Atty Liesl Nelson. eif

records.addlTxt: Court finds Defendant freely, intelligently, knowingly, and understandingly made and waives constitutional right to those time requirements.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:41 PM Defendant Scott Michael Hotchkiss appears in custody from Jail via video, Atty Liesl E. Nelson, ADA Kaley Walker appears for the State of Wisconsin.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant understands charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights. Waives reading. Court reviews DE's rights. ADA Walker is requesting a $5,000.00 SIBS w/conditions of no contact w/T.A.S., no objection. Court so orders. Waive the time limits. DE does qualify for PD. Court confirms address and phone number. Court adjourned at 3:46 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
